agency_desc: A cooperative of school districts that provides centralized special education services to students living within the boundaries of the participating school districts.
service_description: Provides education support for students with disabilities and special needs. Services range from consultation to resource rooms to self-contained classrooms, depending on the individual needs of the student. Assessment and special education services are generally accessed through the assigned public school.
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Living in Clinton Central, Clinton Prairie, Lebanon, North West Hendricks, Rossville, or Western Boone school districts in Boone, and Clinton County -- Ages 3-22 -- With any form of disability that requires special education services (determined by assessment)

agency_name: MENTAL HEALTH AMERICA OF BOONE COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing education, advocacy and service through programs designed to promote health; positively affect public attitudes and perceptions of mental illness through support and knowledge.
site_name: MENTAL HEALTH AMERICA OF BOONE COUNTY
service_description: Provides referrals to case management, clinic therapy, and community education around mental health and addiction issues. Serves Boone County.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for information or referrals.

site_schedule.name: Youth Enrichment Programs
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- Program hours: Mon-Fri 6:30am until start of school; end of school until 6pm

site_eligibility: Varies by program
Pre-K-6 -- Attending elementary school in Lebanon Community or Western Community Schools system

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that delivers nutritionally balanced meals to anyone in need living in Lebanon.
service_description: Delivers nutritionally balanced meals each weekday to anyone in need living in Lebanon. A physician's diet prescription is required. Two weeks' advanced notice preferred. Meals are delivered by volunteers.
site_details: Call to begin the enrollment process. -- Contact physician to request diet prescription.-- Meals prepared by Witham Health Services dietary department.
site_eligibility: Living in Lebanon city limits -- In need of home-delivered meals

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that partners with churches and social service organizations to help persons decrease dependence on government and community resources.

service_description: During the COVID-19 epidemic, providing bags of food for families in need. Bags will feed a family of four for seven meals.
nameLevel4: Home Maintenance and Minor Repair Services
site_details: Call to request a bag of food - may need to leave a voice message
site_eligibility: Living in Boone County
Open

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call for an appointment; leave name, number and brief description of need on voicemail. Generally, calls are returned within 24 hours.
site_eligibility: Veteran -- surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Advance in Boone County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Advance in Boone County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call Boone County dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the town of Advance in Boone County

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Boone County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_details: Varies
site_eligibility: Open

Victims and witnesses of crimes in Boone County

agency_desc: A faith-based organization that provides a food pantry to persons in need.
site_name: SAINT VINCENT DE PAUL OF ST JOSEPH ROMAN CATHOLIC CHURCH
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to people in need. Clients make their own selection from available items. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in to receive a ticket (one per household) -- numbers are drawn randomly and clients are assisted when their number is called.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A faith-based agency providing charitable outreach, including a meal site open to the public.
service_description: Delivers free meals to homebound persons in need, living within city-limits.
site_details: Call to complete a phone assessment and request delivery.
site_eligibility: Living in the city of Lebanon in Boone County -- Homebound individuals 65 years or older -OR- Individuals suffering from illnesses or disability
Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides training for adults to prevent, recognize, and react to child sexual abuse.
service_description: Provides training for adults to prevent, recognize, and react responsibly to child sexual abuse. Training is provided on-site for schools and other organizations. Sessions open to individuals in the community are available.
site_details: Call for availability or for information.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to persons in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Limit one visit per month

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency matching adult mentors to Boone County youth (ages 8-17) who could benefit from a mentor.
service_description: Matches children in need with professionally supported adult mentors who have shared interests and goals. Mentors volunteer approximately once per week for a total of four hours each month.
site_details: To Request a Mentor for a Child: Call or email to request a registration form or more information. To Volunteer: Complete the online application; an in-person interview will be scheduled, generally within one week.
site_eligibility: Living in Boone County -- Youth Participants: Ages 8-17 -- Adult Mentors: Age 18 or older -- With a high school diploma or equivalent -- Pass background check

agency_desc: A faith-based organization in Indiana providing transitional housing for individuals recovering from addiction to substance use.
site_name: INDIANA TEEN CHALLENGE - THE REFUGE GIRLS ACADEMY
service_description: Provides faith-based residential treatment program for female youth who have a chemical dependency. Residents must attend chapel, Bible studies, and be willing to adhere to program rules. Services include community service, life skills training, mentoring, support groups, and referrals to other social services. Ongoing support is provided while continuing their education.
taxonomy_name: Residential Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel4: Residential Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or visit the website to download an application. An application packet may be sent upon request.

site_schedule.name: Residential Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities

site_eligibility: Girls -- Age 13-17 -- Recovering from substance use addiction -- Willing to commit to length of stay

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. agency_desc: A nonprofit organization dedicated to the task of animal welfare, rescue. and education in Boone County, Indiana.
service_description: Assists with sheltering and adoption of animals in Boone County. Also available are Pet Food Pantry resources, trap/neuter/return for feral and community cats, and low cost spay/neuter assistance. The shelter operates through a network of foster homes for both dogs and cats. Appointments required for all meet and greets, adoptions and surrender assistance.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.

site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 9am-5pm: By appointment -- Donation Drop Off: Mon-Fri noon-5pm

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Boone County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Boone County. Operates a 24-hour dispatch service for police officers, firefighters, and medics (ambulances) in Boone County. A ten-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the office during normal business hours. nonemergency dispatch number.

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Boone County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Boone County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Boone County

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides year-round sports training and athletic competition in more than 20 Olympic-type sports for children and adults with intellectual disabilities.
service_description: Offers sports training and competition for youth and adults with intellectual disabilities throughout the year. Individual programs are volunteer-run and vary by county.
site_details: Call or visit the website for county coordinator information.
site_eligibility: Age 8 or older; (Ages 2-7 years-old for Young Athletes program) -- Diagnosed with intellectual disabilities or cognitive delays

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering various social, recreational, and fitness programs.
service_description: Provides behavior change information to those at high risk of developing type 2 diabetes in a classroom setting over the course of 16 one-hour weekly sessions. After the initial 16 core sessions, participants will meet biweekly and then monthly for up to a year.
site_details: Call or send an email to enroll, confirm meeting times and locations, or to ask about potential financial assistance.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- Overweight (BMI greater than or equal to 25%) AND diagnosed with prediabetes via a blood test (If blood test not available, can qualify based on risk factors.)

agency_desc: "The goal of CICOA's Meals & More program is to provide appetizing, nutritionally balanced meals to older adults and those with disabilities either in their homes or at one of more than 30 neighborhood meal sites.  The program is designed to relieve hunger and food insecurity, promote socialization and address proper nutrition education." This program serves Boone, Hamilton, Hancock, Hendricks, Johnson, Marion, Morgan, and Shelby County.
service_name: CICOA NEIGHBORHOOD MEAL SITE - CRAWFORD MANOR
service_description: Offers a hot, nutritious lunch five days a week for area seniors. One day advance notice required.
site_details: Call to make a reservation at least 24 hours in advance.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older and your spouse -- Building residents that are of any age

agency_desc: "The goal of CICOA's Meals & More program is to provide appetizing, nutritionally balanced meals to older adults and those with disabilities either in their homes or at one of more than 30 neighborhood meal sites.  The program is designed to relieve hunger and food insecurity, promote socialization and address proper nutrition education." This program serves Boone, Hamilton, Hancock, Hendricks, Johnson, Marion, Morgan, and Shelby County.
service_name: CICOA NEIGHBORHOOD MEAL SITE - THORNTOWN PUBLIC LIBRARY
service_description: Offers a hot, nutritious lunch each weekday for area seniors. One day advance notice required.
site_details: Call to make a reservation at least 24 hours in advance.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older and your spouse -- Building residents that are of any age

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit organization offering assistance to pregnant women and guardians of young children.
service_description: Counsels women in pregnancy decisions. Provides pregnancy testing and official verification; referrals for medical care, maternity housing, and adoption; pregnancy verification; post-abortion counseling; and limited ultrasound scanning. Also offers infant and toddler clothing (up to 4T), diapers, wipes, and maternity clothes at no charge. Availability varies based on donations.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Walk in, call, or visit website for pregnancy testing, counseling, or to inquire about clothing and diapers.
site_eligibility: Counseling and support services: Open -- Clothing and diapers: Pregnant women and mothers/guardians of infants/toddlers

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides assistance to families in need.
service_description: Providing pre-boxed food for pickup during normal business hours. Extra items will be given to families with children.
site_details: Walk in

site_schedule.schedule: Mon and Wed 8am-2pm; Tues, Thurs, and Fri 11am-5pm -- Monthly 1st Sat 9am-noon

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides assistance to families in need.
service_description: Sells donated clothing, toys and baby items, furniture, appliances, and other household items at discounted prices. Proceeds benefit the agency's food pantry and other social service programs in Boone County. Donations accepted during business hours.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A community action agency that works with partners to promote economic self-reliance and build community wealth.
site_name: COMMUNITY ACTION OF GREATER INDIANAPOLIS - SECTION 8
service_description: Serves as an application and re-certification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program in Boone, Hamilton, Hendricks, and Tipton Counties. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). The wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers in these counties is currently CLOSED. People already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Visit the website for wait list application dates  -- People already on the wait list, call to update contact information as needed.
site_eligibility: Residents of Boone, Hamilton, Hendricks, and Tipton counties -- When the wait list is open, income guidelines will be posted. Preference is given to seniors, persons with disabilities, and working families.

agency_desc: A community action agency that works with partners to promote economic self-reliance and build community wealth.
site_name: COMMUNITY ACTION OF GREATER INDIANAPOLIS - BOONE COUNTY
service_name: WEATHERIZATION - BOONE, HAMILTON, AND HENDRICKS COUNTY
service_description: Provides free weatherization of owner-occupied and rental residences in Boone and Hendricks Counties. Households must be approved for energy assistance to be eligible. Services may include attic insulation, caulking, weather-stripping, furnace repair or replacement, and heat duct and water pipe insulation.
site_details: Call or email to apply or for more information.
site_eligibility: Living in Boone, Hendricks, or Hamilton County -- Household income at or below 200% Federal Poverty Level -- Landlord permission required for rental units

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Boone County.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.

site_schedule.name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices

site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Boone County.
service_description: Serves as a voter registration site and provides information about voting, candidates, absentee voting, and volunteering to work the polls. Oversees county-level elections, candidate filings, and campaign finance.

agency_desc: Serves as the state trail court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500. In Boone County, Superior Court 2 maintains a docket to handle small claims cases.
site_details: Call or walk in for information or to file a claim.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Boone County -- matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Boone County -- matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Boone County
Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trail court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing support services to cancer patients and educating the community on the detection and prevention of cancer.
service_description: Provides case management and support services to persons with cancer living in Boone County. Services may include financial assistance with prescriptions, medical bills, and cancer-related needs such as wigs and prostheses. This agency also coordinates transportation to medical appointments and loans medical equipment, including wheelchairs, beds, and shower chairs.
site_details: Call or walk in to apply for assistance or for information.
site_eligibility: Currently being treated for cancer

agency_desc: A nonprofit Christian housing ministry that builds safe and affordable housing for qualified individuals and families in Boone County.
site_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF BOONE COUNTY
service_description: Builds homes for eligible low-income persons in Boone County. Participants contribute a set number of hours of labor ("sweat equity") toward the construction of a dwelling that they may then purchase through an affordable loan. Volunteer opportunities are also available for interested individuals and service groups.
site_details: Call to request an application.
site_eligibility: Open -- Unable to get conventional loan (no set income guidelines) -- Able to make payments (steady employment history or equivalent income) -- Currently have reasonably good credit

agency_desc: A non profit organization providing equestrian riding services for individuals in a safe and controlled environment.
service_description: Provides therapeutic riding lessons for people with disabilities through equine assisted activities and therapies. Activities may include developing basic riding skills, exercises, and riding trails. Lessons are conducted by a certified instructor with the assistance of trained volunteers. Riders will participate in both mounted and unmounted activities which will focus on building the communication, social and physical skills they need.

agency_desc: A state-government agency working to protect Indiana children who are victims of abuse or neglect and to strengthen families through services that focus on support and preservation. The Department also administers child support, child protection, adoption, and foster care.
site_name: DEPARTMENT OF CHILD SERVICES - BOONE COUNTY
service_description: Investigates reports of suspected child abuse or neglect and takes action on substantiated cases. Under Indiana law, any individual who has a reason to believe a child is a victim of abuse or neglect has the duty to make a report. Reports may be made anonymously.
site_details: Call the hotline to report suspected child abuse or neglect. Call the main desk to inquire about an existing case or to connect to your local DCS office.
site_eligibility: Open
